page.title: 20M.O.D. AT LUDDESDOWN
page.content: In November, l982, it became known that the Ministry of Defence was planning to take over 63O acres of land at Luddesdown for military purposes. An Action Group was set up, supported by organisations such as, The Ramblers Association and The British Horse Society, to fight this proposal.They raised Â£8OOO by selling posters, papers, badges and book marks, by having a barbeque, walking, cycling and organising equestrian events. In November l983, a public enquiry was held.The M.O.D. emphasised the need to train officers and NCO's in mine laying techniques.The Action Group produced experts who explained how this would ruin Luddesdown's tranquility and rural beauty.The M.O.D. were denied approval in December l984.
